p: SARS-CoV-2, like other coronaviruses, is transmitted through respiratory droplets or other fluids, however, these other pathways are not proven. The ( Fig. 1 ) summarizes the main events that occur during the onset of SARS-CoV-2 infection. After infection, the virus undergoes a 4–5 day incubation period, before the onset of symptoms ( Guan et al., 2020). Generally, patients at the time of hospitalization have difficulty breathing, muscle pain, headache, nausea and bloody cough, less common symptoms such as fever and dry cough also occur ( Chan et al., 2020; Chen, Wu, et al., 2020). After the incubation period, on average 5–6 days, the viral load of SARS-CoV-2 reaches its peak, interestingly earlier than that of SARS-CoV, which reaches its viral load around 10 days after the start of the symptoms ( Pan, Zhang, Yang, Poon, & Wang, 2020). In severe cases, on average 8–9 days after the onset of symptoms, the disease progresses to acute respiratory discount syndrome, which in some cases may lead to multiple failures in the function of the lungs and other organs ( Chen, Zhou, et al., 2020).
